thread.title: FIRST ALERT: Looking ahead to warmer weather later next week for Christmas

author: @wis10
title: FIRST ALERT: Looking ahead to warmer weather later next week for Christmas
text:
FIRST ALERT: Looking ahead to warmer weather later next week for Christmas
COLUMBIA, S.C. (WIS) - A warming trend is on the way for the upcoming holiday week, which will lead to well-above normal high temperatures.
First Alert Headlines
- Dry cold front to pass through the Midlands late Sunday.
- Temperatures slightly and briefly cool off Monday behind front.
- Tracking a steady warm up for the Christmas holiday.
First Alert Summary
With high-pressure in control, a nice forecast for this evening is in store across the Midlands. It will get a little chilly overnight with light winds in place and a clear sky overhead. Expect overnight lows to bottom out in the middle 30s by morning.
While Sunday marks the first day of winter, which begins at 10:03 AM, we are tracking above average temperatures in the afternoon. Highs are forecast to peak in the middle to upper 60s under a mix of sun and clouds. There will also be a dry cold front passing through the Midlands by the end of the day, which will mainly have an impact on Monday’s weather.
Temperatures behind this front will cool off a bit with high temperatures back in the middle 50s Monday afternoon. This cool down, however, will be very brief as another warm-up will take over for the rest of the week. We may need to trade our sweaters for short sleeve shirts Christmas Day with forecast highs in the lower 70s!
First Alert Forecast:
Tonight: Mostly clear. Lows in the middle 30s.
Sunday: Sun and clouds.. Highs in the middle to upper 60s.
Monday: Sun and clouds. Highs in the middle 50s.
Tuesday: Partly cloudy. Highs in the middle 60s.
Christmas Eve (Wednesday): Mostly sunny. Highs in the lower 70s.
Christmas Day (Thursday): Mostly sunny. Highs in the lower to middle 70s.
